page.title: 13BELLINGHAM SOCIETIES.
page.content: There are several societies in Bellingham which provide for the arts. The{choral society}performs in village halls and churches throughout the area. There are about 40 members. The{Dramatic Society}caters for the whole district and produces 2 or 3 plays each year. The most recent was staged in the mart ring. It is a very active society with about 30 members. The strangest society is the{North {Tyne and Redeswater Twisty Roads {Preservation Society,}which was started in 1974 by a group of local people to assist various local causes. As worthy groups became in need of extra equipment the Twisty Roaders raised money to purchase whatever was necessary by organising original events. Their headquarters is the residents lounge of the Cheviot Hotel.
